data.title: Experienced Commercial Insurance Consultants
data.meta_description: _linkedin_partner_id = "1426556"; window._linkedin_data_partner_ids = window._linkedin_data_partner_ids || []; window._linkedin_data_partner_ids.push(_linkedin_partner_id); (function(){var s = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0]; var b = document.createElement("script"); b.type …
data.text:
Ron is Chairman of the Board of Bolton and is responsible for setting and overseeing the company’s strategic growth and expansion. He has more than 35 years of industry experience, specializing in risks associated with aviation, education, health care, manufacturing, real estate and technology. Ron has served on agency advisory councils for ACE, AIG, Berkshire Hathaway, Hanover, Hartford, Royal/Sunalliance, St. Paul/Travelers and United Educators Insurance Company. He has been a frequent speaker on a variety of insurance topics including enterprise risk management (ERM), intellectual property insurance, employee benefits and retirement plans and the Affordable Care Act (ACA). Organizations presented to include the Beverly Hills Bar Association, the American Conference Institute on Intellectual Property Insurance, Venture Net Conference, National Association of Independent Schools, California Association of Independent Schools and the National Business Officers Association (NBOA), among others. Ron is a past president of the Independent Insurance Agents Association, Santa Monica, past chairman of the Pacific Network Group (PNG), and has served on the boards of Assurex Global, a worldwide network of leading independent brokers, and the National Alliance Research Academy, a leading provider of education to the insurance industry. Ron received his B.A. from the University of California at Berkeley and did his graduate work at Hastings College of the Law in San Francisco. He holds Certified Insurance Counselor (CIC) and Certified School Risk Manager (CSRM) designations and has served as a national faculty member for the National Alliance for Education. Ron has been active in a variety of civic activities and is a Trustee Emeritus of The Buckley School, past chairman of the American Red Cross (West District, Los Angeles), past president of the Westwood Village Rotary Club, and has served various organizations and boards including the YMCA, MOCA, Hollygrove Orphanage and the Center for Reflective Parenting.

Born and raised in Southern California, Steve graduated from the University of California at Santa Barbara with a double major in Business Economics and Political Science. During his collegiate time at UCSB, Steve was a scholarship member of the Men’s Basketball Team and served as President of his Fraternity.

He began his career as a direct sales representative with Wausau Insurance Company before joining Bolton in 1990.

Steve has served on the Board of Governors of the Western Association of Insurance Brokers, the Board of Directors of the IBA West, and the Board of Directors of the IBA West Service Corporation, including a three-year service as Chairman of the Board of the IBA West Service Corporation and Chairman of the IBA West Strategic Planning Committee.

He has also been honored to have served on the Board of Directors as well as Past Chairman of the Council of Insurance Agents and Brokers (CIAB) which represents the nation’s largest brokers in both national and international affairs. Steve has also served on numerous insurance company advisory councils on both a local and national basis.

He has earned designations as an Associate of Risk Management (ARM) and a Certified Insurance Counselor (CIC). Steve has been with Bolton for over 30 years, and as part of IMA Steve is a large shareholder, a member of the Board of Directors, and President of the firm’s California operations.

Other involvements include past member of the Pasadena Tournament of Roses Association, an active member and Past Chairman of the San Gabriel Valley Chapter of the Young Presidents Organization (YPO), and a Member of the Board of Directors and Past Chairman of AbilityFirst.

Steve currently resides in Arcadia, CA. with his wife Mary and has three children, Tommy (30), Clay (27) and Will (24).

Mike grew up in Texas and graduated from the University of Texas in 1986 with a major in Economics and a minor in Accounting. While at Texas, Mike served in multiple positions in the Alpha Nu chapter of Sigma Chi. With over 25 years of experience in the insurance industry, Mike has had management responsibilities in underwriting, marketing, and sales with both carriers and agencies. He joined Bolton & Company in 2001 where his focus is on the growth of the firm’s recognition as one of the leading privately held insurance brokerages in Southern California, as well as overseeing the day to day operations. Mike’s involvement extends beyond his own firm where he sits on the Advisory Board for multiple National Property Casualty and Health Insurance Carriers. On the personal side, Mike lives in Glendora with his wife, Sharon and three kids, Chris, Kevin and Kate. He has been committed to community by serving on the board of the Foundation for Glendora Unified Schools, the Finance Committee of Citrus Valley Healthcare Partners. He also serves on the Azusa Pacific University School of Business Advisory Board and mentors students in the Business School.

Jason started his insurance career in 1987 with RGV Insurance Agency, which merged with Bolton in 1994. He was a team leader in the Property & Casualty department before transitioning to lead the IT team in 1999 to present. He was awarded Outstanding Customer Service Representative of California in 1998 by The National Alliance For Insurance Education & Research. As an IT department head, he successfully managed major IT system migrations and physical moves to two different Pasadena locations. As Bolton expanded and added branch offices, he also managed the system installation to integrate the offices to the main headquarters. He is actively involved in the Assurex Global IT Group and has chaired three of the annual conferences around the country. He pursued his undergraduate studies in De La Salle University in Manila and earned his Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from University of Phoenix.

With more than 20 years of industry experience, Erin leads Bolton’s Property & Casualty efforts company-wide through its Pasadena headquarters and satellite offices in Santa Clara and Orange County. Erin manages Bolton’s P&C service teams, including small business and claims, while developing new business and expanding the organization’s exclusive programs and offerings. Additionally, she looks to further develop carrier relationships and find new ways to collaborate with Bolton’s key markets. Prior to joining Bolton, Erin was Senior Vice President with Orion Risk Management. In roles prior, she was Senior Vice President and Property & Casualty Practice Leader with Lemme, a division of Integro USA, and Vice President, Unit Manager with Lockton Companies and co-led the Law Firm Practice Group. Erin has been involved in various Women in Leadership organizations, including being one of the co-founders of Lockton’s Southern California Women in Leadership chapter. Erin also managed and mentored the Associate Account Manager/Future Leaders Program for the firm. Erin graduated from the University of San Francisco with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Communication with a focus in Business Law.

Rob consults with for-profit and nonprofit businesses on ways to build benefit programs that are cost effective, and increase overall employee satisfaction. He helps clients to understand the latest industry trends in health care, compliance, and HR technology systems. He is also a true collaborator who believes in making work fun. Rob leverages his background in teaching, marketing and client service to provide meaningful experiences for his clients. He is also an experienced speaker and writer on topics related to business strategy, benefits, ACA compliance, and organizational behavior. Rob was promoted to Executive Vice President and became a shareholder with Bolton in 2016. Rob is currently on the board for PIHRA (Professionals in Human Resources Association) and also Mountainside Communion as a liaison between the church and the Immigration Resource Center of SGV. He holds a Masters in Business Administration from Pepperdine’s Graziadio School of Business Management, and a Bachelor’s degree in Theology and Spanish from Azusa Pacific University.

Brandon Burroughs is an active advocate for his clients, seeking the best resources and solutions that will help move their businesses forward and allow them to focus their time and energy on their business objectives and goals. Brandon launched his pursuit in the employee benefits industry in 2011 working exclusively in managing self-funded clients through monthly claims data analysis, reporting, and meeting with HR and CFO contacts to explain intricacies of claims experience, actuarial calculations, and projected renewal impacts. Working with mid-size and large employers headquartered across the country in various industries, Brandon has traveled to company sites nationwide for renewal meetings, claims-experience and benchmarking presentations, wellness screenings, and employee enrollment meetings. Most recently, Brandon and his wife spent two years teaching at an international school in Caracas, Venezuela where he learned Spanish and taught a variety of math, science, social studies, and religion courses with students ranging from 6th-12th grade. Brandon has a love and appreciation for global awareness and travel that began when he worked as CFO and HR of a boutique hotel in the Himalayan Kingdom of Bhutan for one year immediately following his graduation from his undergraduate studies at Azusa Pacific University. Brandon later returned to Azusa Pacific University to obtain his MBA. In addition to group insurance, Brandon previously provided 401(k) advisory services to mid-size and large employers while holding his Series 6 and 63 securities licenses.

Michelle Cammayo has more than 13 years of Employee Benefits experience specializing in all lines of health and welfare benefits, including medical, dental, vision, basic and voluntary life, short and long-term disability and employee assistance programs. Her passion for learning and knowledge has driven Michelle to become an expert in the industry. Her scope of expertise is expansive as she began her career helping employers manage their employee benefits program where she led renewal negotiations, implemented alternative funding arrangements and conducted open enrollment meetings. Her background and passion for knowledge evolved into a natural shift for Michelle where she works closely with clients and partners to provide guidance in areas of the law including ERISA, HIPAA, COBRA, FMLA and PPACA. She also oversees our Compliance Department at Bolton to ensure we are helping our clients manage and eliminate risk with regards to employee benefit compliance. On a daily basis, she can be found conducting annual compliance reviews with Bolton clients, answering compliance related questions, conducting training for our team members and HR personnel as well as keeping up to date with Federal and State regulation changes. Michelle has authored several employee benefit articles and conducted HRCI accredited seminars in her quest to educate others to empower them to make the best decision for their company. She has given over 30 seminars and webinars on benefit-related topics ranging from compliance challenges to choosing the right consumer driven health plan.

Matt has over 10 years of experience in the Insurance industry. He has been with Bolton since 2004, and is a shareholder in the firm. He is passionate about protecting his clients, and providing excellent service so that they can focus on what they do best, running their businesses. Matt is the head of the Construction Practice Group, and also works in the Distribution, Manufacturing, and Non Profit sectors. He is the Alternative Risk / Captive Specialist for the agency. Matt is an endorsed broker for the California Plumbing Mechanical Contractors Association (CPMCA), National Electrical Contractors Association (NECA), and the Southern California Contractors Association (SCCA). For 10 consecutive years he has won the Bolton Eagle Award, which recognizes top brokers for superior work. Matt holds a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Santa Barbara.

Jeannie has been with Bolton since 2009. With a background in finance, she worked with Countrywide, Bank of America and GMAC for many years. At Bolton, Jeannie supports a variety of industries, including manufacturing, grocery stores, retail and nonprofits. She works closely with her clients to assist in effectively managing their risk exposures, and provides them with valuable resources including claims management, education, safety training and cost reduction. Jeannie attributes her success to a commitment to helping others succeed, and has a passion for giving back. She enjoys supporting organizations that help those in need and is a current board member of FOHA, on the membership committee of the SGVEP and a past board member with PIHRA. She volunteers her time and efforts to many nonprofits including Lincoln Training Center, Children’s Hunger Fund, The Bolton Foundation and local schools. Jeannie attended San Diego State University and has a degree in Business Administration.

Ryan joined Bolton in 2005, following a successful HR career in both the public and private sectors. He consults with finance and HR professionals to reduce the cost of health insurance, enhance benefits, and improve compliance. Ryan has been honored as Bolton’s top consultant for six of the past seven years. He was promoted to Executive Vice President in 2009, and became a shareholder in the firm in 2010. Ryan often speaks at industry events focused on health insurance and employee benefits, including the HR Star Conference, the California HR Conference (PIHRA), and others. He volunteers as Immediate Past Chair for the Professionals in Human Resources Association (PIHRA) in the Pasadena/San Gabriel Valley region. In 2007, he was presented with PIHRA’s “Outstanding Volunteer-of-the-Year” award. Ryan holds a Master’s degree in Organizational Development and a Bachelor’s degree in Communication from Azusa Pacific University. He is recognized as a Senior Professional in Human Resources (SPHR) by the Society of Human Resources Management (SHRM).

As Vice President, Guillermo has a passion for implementing integrated business resource solutions for mid to large organizations and is dedicated to helping employers define company culture through custom employee benefit offerings that save the employer money and cut down on out of pocket expenses for employees. He explores partnership opportunities by building his network with CEOs, COOs, CHROs and CFOs to analyze their current benefit programs, identify cost saving solutions and recommend cost saving alternatives for both employer and employee. His goal is to collaborate with his clients as their business partner, designing unique service models based on each client’s individual needs.

Guillermo brings with him deep industry broker experience, including eight years at Arroyo Insurance Services, and going on 5 years at Bolton where he focuses on serving social service organizations as well as for profit industries. Along with his teams, he strives to implement innovative solutions in employee benefits programs, talent retention strategies, wellness initiatives and organizational development training that strengthen employer brands and deliver improved employee experiences. He holds multiple broker licenses, including Life, Accident, Health and Property & Casualty and is a Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM) Certified Professional (SHRM-CP). Guillermo is very involved in programming with the Community Clinic Association of Los Angeles County and is a member of Professionals In Human Resources Association (PIHRA) Long Beach Chapter. He enjoys connecting with his clients and industry associations outside of the scope of professional services and is regularly featured as a presenter for CFO, COO and HR Roundtables. In his personal time, he likes working on his new home in San Gabriel, walking his dogs, gardening and cooking with his fiancé Michelle.

John started his insurance career with Bolton in 2003 and became a shareholder of the firm in 2011. John’s goal is to protect clients from the risks inherent in owning and operating a business in California. John provides his clients with the risk management and insurance programs that best fit their needs, and has extensive knowledge of workers’ compensation insurance and claims management. He specializes in the rental industry where he currently consults for many of the top party and equipment rental companies in the nation. He also works with manufacturers and distributors, property owners, restaurants and alarm companies. John is involved with the Loyola High School Alumni Association and dedicates time to the Men’s Guild of Children’s Hospital Los Angeles. John was awarded a baseball scholarship and was part of the Honors Finance Program at St. Mary’s College of California. He graduated with a Bachelors of Science in Economics and a Bachelors of Science in Business Administration.

Lyeng has over 15 years of insurance industry experience, focusing her efforts in working with Middle Market businesses and specializing in two core practices: Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) and law firms. Her ABA practice focuses on protecting ABA businesses and employees while making their resources stretch further through strategic consulting on loss control, workers compensation and claims analysis. Clients relying on her to be their trusted advisor include: BECA, Love 2 Learn, Central Valley Autism Project and FirstSteps for Kids, just to name a few. Her law firm specialization derives from her time spent working directly with global placement of insurance programs for international law firms such as O’Melveny & Myers, Sheppard Mullin, and Paul Hastings, as well as, boutique firms like Kabateck Brown Kellner and Roxborough Pomerance & Nye. She has successfully negotiated multi-layered international E&O programs with carriers in London, Bermuda, Switzerland and the United States. Regardless of industry or size, Lyeng’s driving force is her appreciation for the work that her clients do and her commitment to being a key component in their success. She often helps her clients consider non-traditional risk financing solutions through self-funded programs, alternative risk financing and captive development when the solution makes sense – her goal is to always look for what is in her client’s best interest while effectively and efficiently managing risk. Lyeng goes deep with her clients and stays involved throughout the year. Lyeng has been with Bolton & Company since 2014, is a member of Executive Women International, SoCal Tech, and an alumni of the Southern California Leadership Network. She currently holds a California Resident Fire and Casualty License, a Certified Insurance Counselor (CIC) designation, a Certified Risk Manager (CRM) designation and a Certified Insurance Service Representative (CISR) designation. She is currently working on her Charter Property & Casualty Underwriter (CPCU) designation, and is a graduate of the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA).

Before joining Bolton in 2013, Todd was the CEO of Preferred Specialty Insurance Services. He has been in the insurance industry for over 19 years, and holds the following designations: CIC (Certified Insurance Counselor), CRM (Certified Risk Manager) and CRIS (Construction Risk and Insurance Specialist). Todd is passionate about helping clients to reduce their total cost of risk so that they can be more productive and profitable. He specializes in the construction, real estate, manufacturing, wholesale, and health care industries, and is active in the Los Angeles Chapter of NECA (National Electrical Contractors Association) as a member, speaker and writer. Todd feels that it is important to make a positive impact within the insurance industry. He has served as President for the Independent Brokers & Agents of Burbank, Glendale and Pasadena, and was previously the director of the Insurance Brokers & Agents of the West (IBA West). Todd is a recipient of the Harlan Miller Award, which recognizes a broker in California for outstanding dedication to the political grassroots program of the Independent Insurance Agents and Brokers of America (IIABA). Todd holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Business Administration from Point Loma Nazarene University.

Ranya Ku is persistent in her pursuit to find the right risk management and insurance programs that help her clients reach their organizational and financial goals. With a focus on the growing Asian business communities in the region, Ranya works to bridge cultures and develop commercial insurance in the market that address the unique needs of these organizations. An active advocate, she works closely with clients to find the right resources and solutions that will help move their business forward. Her goal is to always look for what is in her client’s best interest while effectively and efficiently managing risk. Ranya has been active in commercial insurance for more than 15 years and has extensive experience working with clients in importer/wholesaler, manufacturer, construction, and commercial real estate roles. She holds a Master of Business Administration in finance and international business from the University of St. Thomas and a Bachelor of Science in Horticulture with a concentration on landscaping architecture in Taiwan. She currently holds a California Resident Fire and Casualty License, Certified Insurance Counselor (CIC), a Certified Risk Manager (CRM) designation, Certified Insurance Service Representative (CISR) and Construction Risk and Insurance Specialist (CRIS) designations.

As Vice President with Bolton’s Asia Practice Group, Terri Luong partners with middle market companies to design innovative risk solutions that offer adequate coverage and cost efficiencies, enabling companies more time to focus on their growth goals. With more than 15 years of experience specializing in Property & Casualty insurance, Terri empowers her clients, particularly those who have outgrown existing smaller broker relationships, with a comprehensive suite of resources to complement an insurance program. She helps companies understand how loss control, safety, compliance, and a holistic risk management philosophy can help drive the success of any business.

Terri is a native Cantonese speaker, and is conversational in Mandarin. She is currently the Co-President of the Asian Business League of Southern California, a professional networking non-profit based in Los Angeles. In her spare time, Terri enjoys Chinese karaoke, racquetball, billiards, playing cards and loves trying new restaurants. She resides with her daughter in Orange County.

Rob brings over 20 years of experience in the health insurance industry, with a diverse background ranging from self-funded products at Cigna to Kaiser’s staff model. His primary objective is to implement effective benefit solutions that promote positive health outcomes for employees. With his expertise in various funding options, pharmacy and stop-loss cost containment, underwriting processes, and engagement tools, Rob provides valuable insights that empower employers to optimize their benefit programs according to their financial, organizational, and cultural needs.

Driven by creativity, Rob constantly seeks innovative approaches to enhance benefits and engage employees in their health plans. For example, he organizes Creative Fairs, designed to foster hobby development, overall well-being, and community building within the office. This initiative is particularly important for remote and hybrid workers, ensuring that they feel connected and engaged.

Originally from the Seattle Washington area, Rob relocated to Southern California in 2010. He holds a BS in Cell & Molecular Biology from the University of Washington. Outside of work, Rob enjoys spending time with his family, watching his son play football, and his passion for oil painting.

Brett brings over 14 years of professional experience to helping businesses identify and implement solutions for workforce management, insurance and risk mitigation. Her diverse experience and field underwriting knowledge allow her to offer a consultative approach to competitive, comprehensive insurance and risk management solutions. Brett’s ability to listen and clearly understand the needs of each individual business allow her to solve problems that have both a direct and indirect impact on client’s bottom line. Her passion and personal dedication have allowed her to build relationships focusing on client concerns. Brett works on business development in addition to crafting risk management and insurance programs for her existing clients. She consults on all placements, including but not limited to workers’ comp, product liability, executive risk, and property. Her clients are from a variety of industries, including advanced manufacturing, clean technology, aerospace, automotive, non-profits, education, construction, transportation and distribution. Brett’s previous experience includes providing consultative solutions to businesses through ADP Employer Services, Zurich American Insurance Company, and Safety Resources Risk Management Organization. She is actively involved in local and national business organizations and philanthropic groups, and currently serves on the board of the Pasadena Police Activities League (PAL). Brett graduated magna cum laude from California State University, Northridge with a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with an emphasis in Finance. She holds the designation of Certified Insurance Counselor (CIC).

R.C. Schrader is the head of Bolton’s Latino Practice Group. He has over 30 of years of experience in international sales, marketing, public relations, and risk management, in both the private and public sectors. Previously, he was appointed by Governor Pete Wilson as Director of the California Trade & Commerce Agency in Mexico, where he spearheaded vital trade and investment opportunities to the mutual benefit of California and Mexico. At Bolton, R.C. has built a team of bilingual and bicultural insurance professionals that cater to Latino businesses. R.C. takes a “tropicalized” approach to his practice, bridging the business and cultural gaps between Latin America and the United States. R.C. studied at UCLA and holds an Honorary Doctorate in Humanities. He has been honored to receive multiple awards and recognitions throughout his career for his professional accomplishments and philanthropic participation. He currently sits on the boards of the Los Angeles Latino Chamber of Commerce, Virtual Entrepreneur Network. Previous positions include the boards of White Memorial Medical Center, the Boys Scouts of American and business advisory boards of SoCal Tech Group, Global Promotions, NAFIN, and Asociación de Empresarios Mexicanos.

Jonathan Schreter focuses on commercial property & casualty risks, primarily for charter and independent schools (K-12) and higher education clients, as well as middle-market businesses in the technology, manufacturing and entertainment industries. With a diverse background that began in marketing, Jonathan combines creative thinking and analytics to offer a consultative approach to risk management. He works with progressive business leaders who appreciate his commitment to preventing unexpected losses. Jonathan earned his MBA from the Anderson School of Business at UCLA in 2000, and his Certified Insurance Counselor (CIC) designation from the National Alliance for Insurance Education and Research in 2010. He is past President of the Independent Brokers & Agents Association of the San Fernando Valley, current President of the UCLA Anderson Alumni Network in Los Angeles, and serves on the Executive Committee for the Board of Directors of Inner-City Arts, a non-profit program that unlocks the creative potential of inner-city children in downtown Los Angeles.

Leading with a client-first focus, Corey looks to partner with the organizations and individuals he works with in order to find the right solutions and service that drive success. With close to a decade of industry experience, Corey has worked with a number of small and medium-sized businesses and is knowledgeable about property and casualty, life and health insurance. Corey specializes in working with elevator contractors, manufacturing, distributing, healthcare and construction. Additionally, he is focused on the unique needs and challenges facing cannabis related business, including dispensaries, cultivators, extractors, developers and much more. Corey joined Bolton in 2014. He is a member of the National Association of Elevator Contractors, and volunteers his time with the Bolton Foundation and Make A Difference. Corey holds a Bachelor’s of Science in Business Administration from DeVry University and is currently pursuing his Certified Insurance Counselors (CIC) designation and Certified Construction Risk and Insurance Specialist (CRIS) designations.

Ken joined Bolton in 1990, and holds an Associate in Risk Management (ARM) designation. He specializes in working with manufacturers, property owners, contractors, and security guard companies to identify potential exposures, and to design comprehensive risk management programs. Ken is active with the Independent Insurance Agents & Brokers of California (IIABCal) and is currently President of the association. He has also served on the Executive Committee for the past three years. He served as a Southern California Regional Director for IIABCal and has served on various committees at the state level. He was the chairperson of the IBA West Service Corporation from 2007-2009. He is also the past president of the local chapter of the Insurance Brokers & Agents of Burbank, Glendale and Pasadena. Ken graduated from the University of Redlands (CA) with a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration.
